column5: So it looks like I have to upgrade my trailer so I can get two ATV's on it..  Does anyone know anywhere down there (GTA) that would have a selection of ATV trailers for me to look at if i get to Toronto early enough on Friday.. I think I'm looking for a side loading one but I'm not sure... anyone else got any experiences trailering two ATV's??  Any suggestions...
Check these guys out....  http://www.miskatrailers.com/index_a.asp does that get me free tickets to the show??????
I was looking at this one already...  http://www.miskatrailers.com/product_detai...d=23&pid=16  The price sure is right...
Looks like a nice trailer for the dollar!
Not quite GTA, but I've had good luck with Eastons on hwy. 115 just north of the 401. I have two of thier trailers, and thier both great rigs. Price was right too.  S.

My shorelander boat trailer needed work a few years ago and I was told of Excalibur trailers in Brampton. They were incredible for service and I'm planning to drop the trailer with them again this year for a new paint job  They have some ATV trailers on their site and a neat double/side loader at the bottom of the page  http://www.excalibur-trailers.com/other.html
wow, I don't think you will find a better price

One thing I would add is to get galvanized or aluminum. Its worth it in the long run.  The price on that trailer above almost seems too good to be true. I'd make sure of what your getting with that deal. I paid $2500 for a 6X12 galv, with 3500lb axle. If your towing it in the winter, get a shield on it too......another thing that's worth its weight in gold. Road salt and grime does a real number on machines.  S.

Try giving nandos a call here in the hammer.Their pretty reasonable.Also there is one on hwy 6 north jdj I beleive in flamborough.You can also try D C  leasing, but I think Dave is venturing away from small trailers.
